description: A tasty twist on satay skewers.
name: Satay Chicken Wing Bowl Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 2 tbs brown sugar (or coconut sugar from woolies)
3-5 tbs olive oil (for baking and bbq of the chicken wings)

recipeInstructions.text: If you have a mortar and pestle mash the lemongrass,shallots,add all the spices and salt sugar OR use a bowl and a meat mallet to pound the spices.
Rub the paste all over the chicken wings.
Now place the chicken wings in a baking dish brush with oil, cook on a low to medium heat until about 90 per cent cooked. Around 60 mins at 100 degrees. Low and slow.
Finish cooking the chicken wings on the BBQ. Turn them every so often so they don't burn from the sugars in the marinade.

I served mine in a large bowl with Turmeric rice, pineapple slices, BBQ Satay prawns with fresh coriander and cucumber. I used the same spice mix and marinated some prawns for a few hours in the satay spice mix then BBQ cooked then just before the chicken wings were cooked. Serve with your favourite satay sauce and oven roasted peanuts tossed in a sweet chilli salt glaze. This looks so cool in a massive stainless steel bowl. Enjoy!
